meanings.definition: Tellurions: a hypothetical substance that is supposed to fill all space and to be the medium of transmission of electromagnetic waves.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the properties of tellurions to understand how they interact with electromagnetic waves.
meanings.sent2: The concept of tellurions in physics helps explain the transmission of energy through space.
meanings.sent3: In a science fiction story, aliens use tellurions to power their advanced technology.
meanings.sent4: The idea of tellurions as the invisible fabric of the universe sparks the imagination.
meanings.sent5: Imagine tellurions as the invisible threads connecting all celestial bodies in the cosmos.

meanings.definition: Tellurions: a hypothetical substance that is supposed to fill all space and to be the medium of transmission of electromagnetic waves.
meanings.sent1: The tellurions theory proposes a unique way of understanding the universe.
meanings.sent2: Many scientists debate the existence of tellurions as the medium for electromagnetic waves.
meanings.sent3: The tellurions in this sci-fi movie are portrayed as sentient beings controlling energy flow.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a vast network of tellurions, connecting thoughts and ideas effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted the cosmos as a web of shimmering tellurions.
